intro: Andromeda cupressina, commonly known as the sweet root or sweet woodruff, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces a fragrant, aromatic resin that has been historically used in perfumes and traditional medicine. Its roots are also known for their sweet scent and have been utilized in herbal remedies. Andromeda cupressina thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
